greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Expansion of chi(-q) * phi(-q^3) * psi(q^3) in powers of q where chi(), phi(), psi() are Ramanujan theta functions.
comment: Ramanujan theta functions: f(q) (see A121373), phi(q) (A000122), psi(q) (A010054), chi(q) (A000700).
link: G. C. Greubel, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..1000
Christian Kassel, Christophe Reutenauer, The Fourier expansion of eta(z)eta(2z)eta(3z)/eta(6z), arXiv:1603.06357 [math.NT], 2016.
Michael Somos, Introduction to Ramanujan theta functions
Eric Weisstein's World of Mathematics, Ramanujan Theta Functions
formula: Expansion of q^(-1/3) * eta(q) * eta(q^3) * eta(q^6) / eta(q^2) in powers of q.
mathematica: a[ n_] := SeriesCoefficient[ QPochhammer[ x^3] QPochhammer[ x^6] / QPochhammer[ -x, x], {x, 0, n}];
program: (PARI) {a(n) = my(A); if( n<0, 0, A = x * O(x^n); polcoeff( eta(x + A) * eta(x^3 + A) * eta(x^6 + A) / eta(x^2 + A), n))};
results.author: _Michael Somos_, May 25 2015
